body_html:
What version of the Android NDK are you using? We're working to update bazel to work with Android NDK r11, so for now you'll want to use r10e:
http://dl.google.com/android/repository/android-ndk-r10e-darwin-x86_64.zip

What is the content of $NDK_PATH/RELEASE.TXT?
Bazel uses that file to figure out if you have a 32-bit or 64-bit NDK.
body_text:
What version of the Android NDK are you using? We're working to update bazel to work with Android NDK r11, so for now you'll want to use r10e:
http://dl.google.com/android/repository/android-ndk-r10e-darwin-x86_64.zip
What is the content of $NDK_PATH/RELEASE.TXT?
Bazel uses that file to figure out if you have a 32-bit or 64-bit NDK.
body:
What version of the Android NDK are you using? We're working to update bazel to work with Android NDK r11, so for now you'll want to use r10e:
http://dl.google.com/android/repository/android-ndk-r10e-darwin-x86_64.zip

What is the content of `$NDK_PATH/RELEASE.TXT`?
Bazel uses that file to figure out if you have a 32-bit or 64-bit NDK.
